qas.question: How many millimeters of rain do the northern atolls of the Marshall Islands receive?
What is the main source of fresh water for the Marshall Islands?
What is the Marshall Islands often threatened with?
How much more rain do the southern atolls get compared to the northern?

context: Population has outstripped the supply of freshwater, usually from <a1_0>rainfall<a1_0/>. The northern atolls get 50 inches (<a0_0>1,300<a0_0/> mm) of rainfall annually; the southern atolls about <a3_0>twice<a3_0/> that. The threat of <a2_0>drought<a2_0/> is commonplace throughout the island chains.
